document_data.name: Song of the North
document_data.mainbody:
'''Song of the North''' was a poem composed by an unnamed [[bard]]. It comprised multiple sonnets, including sonnet 5, which detailed the history of [[giant]]s and [[Hartsvale]]. {{quote|In [[Hartsvale]] did the hero [[giant]] rise
And lead the smallfolk 'gainst his tyrannous kin.
The [[Ice Spires|Ice Spire]] tempests filled with rallying cries,
As smallfolks's time in Hartsvale did begin.
The Ice Spire peaks did so the giants claim:
The [[frost giant|frost clans]] by the [[Bleak Plain]] to the north;
The southern range, home to the [[fire giant|giants of flame]];
The [[hill giant]]s to the west (for what they're worth).
In [[Castle Hartwick]], midst the [[Clear Whirl River|Clear Whirl]]'s run,
Now sits the Good King [[Grauman]] on his throne.
With truce 'tween giantkind and smallfolk spun,
The folk of Hartsvale now are on their own.
So long as peace continues in the vale,
So shall the folk of [[Stagwick]] e'er prevail. |Sonnet 5 of ''Song of the North''}}
